episode_summary: This episode features discussions on historical child-rearing practices, unusual royal deaths, the secretive whale bone collection of the Natural History Museum, and the eccentricities of poet Gerard Manley Hopkins.

facts.fact: Child rearing advice in the 17th century included tossing your baby up in a blanket to strengthen its nerves or firing pistols near it to boost its endurance.
France has lost at least two of its kings due to death by walking into the frame of a very low door.
The Natural History Museum's collection of whale bones is so significant, they won't tell anyone where it is.
Gerard Manley Hopkins once had nothing to drink for a week for a bet. He only stopped when his tongue went black.
